response_parsed.title: Refactoring Jupyter Notebooks to Production using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to convert a Jupyter Notebook into a production-ready web application using FastAPI in Python 3.12+, improving the scalability, maintainability, and security of your data science projects.
key_points: Understand the benefits and drawbacks of Jupyter Notebooks for production
Install and set up the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+
Explore best practices for converting notebook cells into FastAPI endpoints
Learn about testing and version control strategies for your FastAPI application
Deploy your production-ready FastAPI app using popular web servers

code_examples.code:
from fastapi.testclient import TestClient
client = TestClient(app)
response = client.get('/items/1')
assert response.status_code == 200

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial due to new features and improvements in the language
FastAPI version 0.65.x or higher is recommended
Jupyter Notebook version 6.0+ should be used
caveats: Always consider security when exposing your application to the internet, such as using proper authentication and authorization
Properly test your FastAPI app before deploying it to production
When converting notebooks to FastAPI, keep the code organized, clean, and modular for easy maintenance
